title: 11. IRRI Agronomy Challenge: Assessing Biotic Influences at Maximum Tillering (16 February 2012)

tasks.task: Conducting a comprehensive biotic influence assessment on a rice crop
subtasks: Observing crop growth stages (maximum tillering, disease/pest susceptibility)
Identifying biotic factors affecting the crop (insects, weeds, fungi, viruses)
Collaborating with a specialist (Nancy Castillo) in assessing biotic influences
Sampling for insect pests using a sweep net (counting green leaf hoppers)
Collecting data on injecting insect pests (white-backed and brown plant hoppers)
Evaluating damage from snails, rats, and other animal pests
Assessing weed growth in relation to crop canopy
Recording types and height of weeds in quadrat areas (1m x 1m)
Checking for viral, bacterial, and fungal diseases
Documenting the impact of animal pests (rat damage to rice plants)
Monitoring crop health across different growth stages (maximum tillering, reproductive, grain filling)

tasks.task: Implementing pest and disease management strategies
subtasks: Conducting regular inspections for pest and disease outbreaks
Applying integrated pest management techniques (e.g., chemical control, biological control)
Monitoring rodent populations and implementing control measures
Maintaining rice field borders to prevent pest ingress
Documenting progress and modifying strategies based on assessment data

tasks.task: Maintaining crop health through environmental stewardship
subtasks: Evaluating the impact of insect and animal pests on crop yield
Adjusting cultural practices to minimize biotic stress (e.g., proper irrigation, fertilization)
Protecting farm infrastructure (e.g., bait stations) to deter rodents
Educating staff on pest and disease identification and control
